file summary: This `pom.xml` file serves as the central configuration for the `spring-petclinic` Maven project, a Spring Boot application. It inherits from `spring-boot-starter-parent` version 3.5.0, establishing a baseline for consistent dependency management and build configurations. The file defines essential project metadata such as `groupId` (`org.springframework.samples`), `artifactId` (`spring-petclinic`), and `version` (`3.5.0-SNAPSHOT`). It specifies project properties including the target Java version (17), encoding, and versions for various development tools and libraries like WebJars, Checkstyle, and JaCoCo. The POM declares a comprehensive set of dependencies crucial for a modern Spring Boot application, including starters for Actuator, Cache, JPA, Web, Validation, and Thymeleaf, along with test dependencies. It supports multiple databases (H2, MySQL, PostgreSQL) and caching with Caffeine. Furthermore, the build section outlines various Maven plugins that enforce code quality, formatting, and orchestrate build processes, such as `maven-enforcer-plugin` (Java version enforcement), `spring-javaformat-maven-plugin` (code formatting), `maven-checkstyle-plugin` (code style checks), `jacoco-maven-plugin` (code coverage), and `spring-boot-maven-plugin` (for building runnable JARs and generating build info). It also includes plugins for GraalVM native image compilation, Git commit ID integration, and Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) generation. The file defines `css` and `m2e` profiles for specific build tasks (SCSS compilation) and IDE integration respectively, and configures Spring snapshot/milestone repositories.
